briefdescription.para: Process MFCCs that are in the internal buffer into features.
Initialize an acoustic model.

parameterdescription.para: a command-line object containing parameters. This pointer is not retained by this object.
global log-math parameters.

a previously-initialized acoustic feature module to use, or NULL to create one automatically. If this is supplied and its parameters do not match those in the acoustic model, this function will fail. This pointer is not retained.

a previously-initialized dynamic feature module to use, or NULL to create one automatically. If this is supplied and its parameters do not match those in the acoustic model, this function will fail. This pointer is not retained.

simplesect.para: a newly initialized acmod_t, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Finalize an acoustic model.
Adapt acoustic model using a linear transform.

parameterdescription.para: The new transform to use, or NULL to update the existing transform. The decoder retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use ps_mllr_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

simplesect.para: The updated transform object for this decoder, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Write senone dump file header.
Start logging senone scores to a filehandle.

parameterdescription.para: Acoustic model object.
Filehandle to log to.

briefdescription.para: Start logging MFCCs to a filehandle.

parameterdescription.para: Acoustic model object.
Filehandle to log to.

briefdescription.para: Start logging raw audio to a filehandle.

parameterdescription.para: Acoustic model object.
Filehandle to log to.

briefdescription.para: Set memory allocation policy for utterance processing.

parameterdescription.para: If non-zero, the internal dynamic feature buffer will expand as necessary to encompass any amount of data fed to the model.

briefdescription.para: Mark the start of an utterance.
Mark the end of an utterance.
TODO: Set queue length for utterance processing.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows multiple concurrent passes of search to operate on different parts of the utterance. Feed raw audio data to the acoustic model for scoring.

parameterdescription.para: In: Pointer to buffer of raw samples Out: Pointer to next sample to be read
In: Number of samples available Out: Number of samples remaining
If non-zero, this block represents a full utterance and should be processed as such.

simplesect.para: Number of frames of data processed.

briefdescription.para: Feed acoustic feature data into the acoustic model for scoring.

parameterdescription.para: In: Pointer to buffer of features Out: Pointer to next frame to be read
In: Number of frames available Out: Number of frames remaining
If non-zero, this block represents a full utterance and should be processed as such.

simplesect.para: Number of frames of data processed.

briefdescription.para: Feed dynamic feature data into the acoustic model for scoring.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike acmod_process_raw() and acmod_process_cep(), this function accepts a single frame at a time. This is because there is no need to do buffering when using dynamic features as input. However, if the dynamic feature buffer is full, this function will fail, so you should either always check the return value, or always pair a call to it with a call to acmod_score().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to one frame of dynamic features.

briefdescription.para: Set up a senone score dump file for input.

parameterdescription.para: File handle of dump file

briefdescription.para: Rewind the current utterance, allowing it to be rescored.

detaileddescription.para: After calling this function, the internal frame index is reset, and acmod_score() will return scores starting at the first frame of the current utterance. Currently, acmod_set_grow() must have been called to enable growing the feature buffer in order for this to work. In the future, senone scores may be cached instead.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 for failure (if the utterance can't be rewound due to no feature or score data available)

briefdescription.para: Advance the frame index.

detaileddescription.para: This function moves to the next frame of input data. Subsequent calls to acmod_score() will return scores for that frame, until the next call to acmod_advance().

memberdef.argsstring: (acmod_t *acmod, int n_active, uint8 const *active, int16 const *senscr, FILE *senfh)
memberdef.name: acmod_write_scores

briefdescription.para: Write a frame of senone scores to a dump file.
Internal version, used for reading previous frames in acmod_score()
Read one frame of scores from senone score dump file.

simplesect.para: Number of frames read or <0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Get a frame of dynamic feature data.

parameterdescription.para: Input: frame index to get, or NULL to obtain features for the most recent frame. Output: frame index corresponding to this set of features.

simplesect.para: Feature array, or NULL if requested frame is not available.

briefdescription.para: Score one frame of data.

parameterdescription.para: Input: frame index to score, or NULL to obtain scores for the most recent frame. Output: frame index corresponding to this set of scores.

simplesect.para: Array of senone scores for this frame, or NULL if no frame is available for scoring (such as if a frame index is requested that is not yet or no longer available). The data pointed to persists only until the next call to acmod_score() or acmod_advance().

briefdescription.para: Get best score and senone index for current frame.
Clear set of active senones.
Activate senones associated with an HMM.
Build active list from.
Acoustic model structures for PocketSphinx.
